item.title: Ticket #3384 (get_the_category() is broken) closed
item.dc:creator: foolswisdom
item.description:
fixed:

Re-marking as CLOSED fixed as original submitter marked it closed and no one else has said here they are still experiencing this issue. Please reopen with additional details if anyone is still experiencing this problem.

Hi Tassoman,

Are you saying that you upgraded to r4532 and are no longer seeing the issue? As Viper points out that is different than saying it is resolved *in* that revision.

And thank you for the great contribution to WordPress!

item.title: Ticket #3384 (get_the_category() is broken) reopened
item.dc:creator: Viper007Bond
item.description:
Er, whoops, hit submit without meaning to.

Anyway, gonna reopen until it's actually confirmed it's fixed. [4532] is just a version bump.

item.title: Ticket #3290 (Importer strips img class and style) updated
item.dc:creator: filosofo
item.description: I think the real problem is that wp-admin/admin.php calls kses_init_filters() for *every* import, even for those with admin permissions, and there's no easy way--that I've yet found--for a plugin to disable it.

item.title: Ticket #3391 (Can't click Labels for Radio Buttons in Moderation Queue) updated
item.dc:creator: JeremyVisser
item.description:
Type changed

Replying to shorty114:

Also, I would put the <label> wrapped *around* the input. Can't remember why though.

The reason I didn't do that is because I'm fixing it the same way Matt fixed it for 2.1.

item.title: Ticket #3391 (Can't click Labels for Radio Buttons in Moderation Queue) updated
item.dc:creator: shorty114
item.description:
Replying to shorty114:

I don't this is *absolutely necessary* for 2.0... 2.1 is coming out in ~2 months, can people live without it until then? ;)

Also, I would put the <label> wrapped *around* the input. Can't remember why though.

Never mind, this is a good patch.

item.title: Ticket #3391 (Can't click Labels for Radio Buttons in Moderation Queue) updated
item.dc:creator: shorty114
item.description:
Owner, Priority, Status, Severity, Type changed

I don't this is *absolutely necessary* for 2.0... 2.1 is coming out in ~2 months, can people live without it until then? ;)

Also, I would put the <label> wrapped *around* the input. Can't remember why though.

item.title: moderation.php.diff attached to Ticket #3391
item.dc:creator: JeremyVisser
item.description: Patch for moderation.php to fix radio button labels.

item.title: Ticket #3391 (Can't click Labels for Radio Buttons in Moderation Queue) created
item.dc:creator: JeremyVisser
item.description:
In WordPress 2.0.5, with a comment in the moderation queue, go to WordPress Admin → Manage → Awaiting Moderation (x). Try clicking the labels for the radio buttons "Approve", "Spam", "Delete", "Defer until later". That does not work because the IDs and corresponding label elements do not match.

This problem has been fixed for /trunk/, but the 2.0 branch still has the problem. Attached is a patch to fix the problem.

item.title: Ticket #3390 (Better get_page_uri) closed
item.dc:creator: foolswisdom
item.description:
duplicate:

Marking as duplicate of 3373. Only one ticket for a problem regardless of the version or milestone.

Thank you for contributing to WordPress!

I am a layperson, but the nature of the problem and the fix looks great!

item.title: get_page_uri.2.0.5 attached to Ticket #3390
item.dc:creator: ryanscheuermann
item.description: better & faster get_page_uri

item.title: Ticket #3390 (Better get_page_uri) created
item.dc:creator: ryanscheuermann
item.description:
I posted this ticket for trunk, but I figured I'd duplicate it here as well.

This patch replaces get_page_uri with a version that only executes 1 general query instead of 1 for every single page in the tree. This is mainly an optimization for pages that display complete page heirarchies / navigation menus.

The trunk ticket is here: #3373

item.title: get_page_uri.2.0.5 attached to Ticket #3373
item.dc:creator: ryanscheuermann
item.description: faster get_page_uri for WP 2.0.5

item.description: fixed bug: include attachment uris

item.title: Ticket #3380 (Make autosave interval configurable) updated
item.dc:creator: masquerade
item.description: In the same manner, Viper may think that you needlessly and senselessly closing a ticket without any real rationalization is rude and unhelpful, and will therefore respond in the same manner.

item.title: Ticket #3380 (Make autosave interval configurable) updated
item.dc:creator: foolswisdom
item.description:
Not being able to set something is not a problem in itself. Explaining the importance of why being able to set the interval is essential in this scenario.

Language like "ridiculous, WTF, and christ" hurts my feels, and I don't think is helpful.

Err... he did?

Problem: Users cannot set autosave interval. Possible solution: Create option allowing users to set autosave interval.

What the christ is wrong with that?

item.title: Ticket #3386 (box-bg-right.gif isn't wide enough) created
item.dc:creator: Viper007Bond

On high resolutions, the background image on the bottom draggable boxes isn't wide enough:

It needs to be wider and while we're at it, we might as well make it only 1px tall. I've taken the honors.

item.title: Ticket #3382 (formatting.php - sanitize_file()) updated
item.dc:creator: Viper007Bond
item.description:
Replying to masquerade:

Can we name it sanitize_file_name() or sanitize_filename(), sanitize_file() makes it sound like we are actually doing something to a file.

Agreed.
